titles: Russian soldier pleads guilty in first war crimes trial of Ukraine conflict
descriptions: The 21-year-old admits killing an unarmed civilian, in Ukraine's first war crimes trial since war began.

titles: Pennsylvania primary: Trump-backed 'Dr Oz' in cliffhanger vote count
descriptions: Celebrity surgeon Mehmet Oz's bid to become the next Republican senator from Pennsylvania is in jeopardy.

titles: AG Perarivalan: India top court frees killer of ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi
descriptions: AG Perarivalan spent 30 years in jail for procuring batteries used in the bomb to kill India's former PM.

titles: US Soccer equal-pay deal could 'change game globally'
descriptions: An equal-pay agreement between the United States men's and women's teams has been hailed as potentially "changing the game around the world".

titles: McDonald's and Wendy's sued for burger ads that mislead on size
descriptions: A lawsuit accuses the firms of advertising burgers that look bigger than they actually are.

titles: China Eastern plane crash likely intentional, US reports say
descriptions: Flight data reportedly indicates someone in the cockpit made the China Eastern Airlines jet crash.

titles: Cyclone Yakecan batters Uruguay and Brazil
descriptions: At least two people are dead and hundreds of thousands have been left without electricity.

titles: Gambler to pay back Japanese Covid-19 fund he spent
descriptions: The man's lawyer said his client gambled the pay-out after it was mistakenly paid to his bank account.

titles: US military probe finds no wrongdoing in deadly Syria air strike
descriptions: Dozens of people, including women and children, were killed in the 2019 strike on an IS position.

titles: Cyclist abandons race after popping cork in eye
descriptions: Italy's Alberto Dainese is a surprise winner of stage 11 of the Giro d'Italia after Biniam Girmay was forced to abandon this year's race.

titles: Lancet study: Pollution killed 2.3 million Indians in 2019
descriptions: The report found that nearly 1.6 million deaths in India were due to air pollution alone.

titles: Ukraine war: 'I had to stay below ground for more than 60 days'
descriptions: Katerina spent more than two months beneath the besieged Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol, Ukraine.

titles: Mariupol's Azovstal fighters: What next for Ukraine's captured soldiers
descriptions: Ukraine wants to exchange them for Russian prisoners of war, but some in Russia want them put on trial.

titles: Capitol riots loom large in Republican primaries
descriptions: Deniers of the 2020 election results are among the biggest winners of the Republican primary

titles: Afghanistan: The secret girls school defying the Taliban
descriptions: The teachers fear being arrested or beaten after the Taliban banned most teenage girls from education.

titles: Australia election: A simple guide
descriptions: Australians go to the polls on 21 May, for the country's first election since 2019.

titles: Philly Lutaaya: The Ugandan singer who led the fight against HIV prejudice
descriptions: HIV-positive Ugandan singer Philly Lutaaya was ostracised by some but his openness shifted attitudes.

titles: MÃ¥neskin's crazy rise to fame: 'We only slept in our own beds 10 times last year'
descriptions: The Italian rock band relive the highs and lows of becoming a global success after winning Eurovision.

titles: Lebanon election results raise spectre of new power struggle
descriptions: Prolonged deadlock could ensue after Hezbollah's allies lost seats to their rivals, says Anna Foster.

titles: Mariupol: Key moments in the siege of the city
descriptions: As Ukrainian fighters are evacuated from the Azovstal steelworks, how Russia has closed in on the city.

titles: Buffalo shooting: How far-right killers are radicalised online
descriptions: A movement of online extremists targets innocent people in shooting rampages that follow a similar blueprint.

titles: Anti-abortion groups target women with misleading ads
descriptions: Abortion providers describe a battle to put out accurate information.

titles: Woman kidnapped as a child reunites with rescuer
descriptions: Kathy Wrethman, from Australia, has finally come face-to-face with the man who saved her life.

titles: China's silenced feminist: How Sophia Huang Xueqin went missing
descriptions: BBC Eye investigates the disappearance of Sophia Huang Xueqin, a high-profile feminist journalist who kick-started China's #MeToo movement.

titles: Scott Morrison crashes into a boy during football match
descriptions: Scott Morrison was playing five-a-side on the campaign trail ahead of Australia's election on Saturday.

titles: Sweden and Finland formally submit Nato applications
descriptions: The alliance's secretary general Jens Stoltenberg says it is "a historic moment, which we must seize".

titles: Colombian robbery victim crashes car into thieves
descriptions: The thieves stole a watch and mobile phone before the victim drove into them in his convertible.
